qas.question: The easiest way to learn about brain anatomy is by what?
Brain tissue is naturally soft, but can be stiffened with what liquid?
The two main areas of the brain are what colors?

answers.text: grey matter, with a dark color, separated by areas of white matter

qas.question: What instrument can you use to examine the microstructure of the brain?
Grey matter of the brain is what color?

context: The simplest way to gain information about brain anatomy is by <a0_0>visual inspection<a0_0/>, but many more sophisticated techniques have been developed. Brain tissue in its natural state is too soft to work with, but it can be hardened by immersion in <a1_0>alcohol<a1_0/> or other fixatives, and then sliced apart for examination of the interior. Visually, the interior of the brain consists of areas of so-called <a2_0>grey matter, with a <a4_0>dark color<a4_0/>, separated by areas of white matter<a2_0/>, with a lighter color. Further information can be gained by staining slices of brain tissue with a variety of chemicals that bring out areas where specific types of molecules are present in high concentrations. It is also possible to examine the microstructure of brain tissue using a <a3_0>microscope<a3_0/>, and to trace the pattern of connections from one brain area to another.
